metadata.title: CVE-2021-46909 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:ARM: footbridge: fix PCI interrupt mappingSince commit 30fdfb929e82 ("PCI: Add a call to pci_assign_irq() inpci_device_probe()"), the PCI code will call the IRQ mapping functionwhenever a PCI driver is probed. If these are marked as __init, thiscauses an oops if a PCI driver is loaded or bound after the kernel hasinitialised.

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-aws package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-azure package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
